topics.body:
My guess as to what future warfare will look like is a platoon of micro tanks like Tachikomas who support and guard cyborg operators in local areas.  Basically Ghost in the Shell again.
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b72be063687227a10c0600#post_54b72be063687227a10c0600
[bq="Number1pegasus"]"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b72b596368722922b10c00#post_54b72b596368722922b10c00

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b72ba1636872208f650400#post_54b72ba1636872208f650400
Arent people actually working on that?[/bq]
Hoverboards could totally exist, *BUT* copper needed to make platforms they can move across is ungodly expensive.

"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b72c1e6368726483f90e00#post_54b72c1e6368726483f90e00
[bq="trashboat"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b72a046368725cd6ec0600#post_54b72a046368725cd6ec0600
It kind of irks me that Moe anthro versions of Mazinger robots is one of the most popular versions of the mazinger mythos in awhile. (Shin Mazinger was probably one of the best shows in the mecha genre, And Mazinkaiser SKL was pretty fun too.)[/bq]
:[
Fans of gijinka have been waiting for decades for mainstream anime to take us seriously.  That's like getting irked at mecha fans for getting excited that Pacific Rim, despite all it's problems, is the first not michael bay western mecha and/or not complete shit western mecha in over a decade.  If a specific genre has been on life support for a decade people are going to be excited for when it comes out of it's coma.

topics.body:
"@Gizoid101":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b72c866368726905251000#post_54b72c866368726905251000
*If we were to make powered armor for soldiers to use, we would expect something like this:*
!http://www.writeups.org/img/inset/Iron_Man_movie_mkIII_flight_h1.jpg!
!http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/7/77/Master_Chief_in_Halo_4.png!
*But I think the more likely suits we'll get are these:*
!http://static4.businessinsider.com/image/538fd1f46bb3f7414fd5d4c4-1200-924/edge-of-tomorrow-tom-cruise-3.jpg!
!http://img2-2.timeinc.net/ew/i/2013/08/07/ELYSIUM-SHARLTO-COPLEY.jpg!

Or we'll never get feasible and cost-effective exosuits, because real life is a fickle bitch to our inner fantasies and escapist fiction.
